page.title: 07Traffic Census
page.content: The ever_increasing volume of traffic on roads has led to great problems in wear and tear of the roads, and large increase in accidents. Census May 11th 1982 on a 12 hour two way count was 4237 vehicles.Similar count November 7th 1983 on a 10 hour two way count was 6,000+ Reason for this was the traffic being redirected by Wilts C.C.from the A30 at Lopscombe Corner via Stockbridge to London, to the A343 Andover by_pass thence to the M3.Also alterations at Micheldever on the A303 encourages traffic from London to use the Andover route. Speed is one of the main factors causing accidents.Much public pressure has been exerted on those in authority ie:the County Surveyor and the police for speed restrictions and extra double white lines to no avail.
